alert.note: Alert for Cattaraugus (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 6:34AM EST until February 21 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Allegheny River At Olean affecting Cattaraugus County. Allegheny River At Salamanca affecting Cattaraugus County. .Heavy rain and snowmelt yesterday will continue to result in flooding. For the Allegheny River...including Olean, Salamanca...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Allegheny River At Olean. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:16 AM EST Friday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this morning to 14.2 feet this evening. It will then fall to 14.0 feet and begin rising again just after midnight tonight. It will rise to 14.6 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.2 feet on 01/13/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM EST.
